title: Nicole Kidman wears plunging gown for ELLE Women in Hollywood feature
text:
A leading role in HBO drama Big Little Lies gave her warm, welcome and well received return to television after almost four decades of cinematic success.

And Nicole Kidman’s easy transition to the small screen is in no small part responsible for her unveiling as one of ELLE's illustrious 2019 Women in Hollywood.

The Australian actress joins an array of empowered female high-achievers – among them Margot Robbie, Scarlett Johansson and Gwyneth Paltrow – for a glamorous new shoot following a productive year, during which she won a new legion of fans thanks to her role as Celeste Wright.

Centre stage: Nicole Kidman has been named as one of ELLE'S illustrious 2019 Women in Hollywood

But while the first two seasons of Big Little Lies have yielded commercial success, critical accolades and eight Emmy Awards, Nicole admits there might be a significant wait before it finally returns.

Talking to the latest edition of Elle as part of their Women in Hollywood celebration, the actress revealed the show - which features an all-star cast including Reese Witherspoon and Meryl Streep - has been put to one side while she focuses on new film Bombshell, in which she stars alongside Charlize Theron.

'Everyone says, "Are you going to do a season three?" We’re like, "Just give us a sec,"' she explained.

Stunning: The actress wears a black veil and plunging dress while posing in a cover shoot for the magazine's November edition, during which she reflects on her role in Big Little Lies

Read all about it: The full interview is available in the November 2019 issue of Elle

'We’d love to [do another season] because we love being together, and it’s lovely spending time with your friends, and with such good material. It’s part of the reason I wanted to do Bombshell, to support Charlize.'

The new film will see Kidman play TV journalist Gretchen Carlson in an account of the sexual harassment accusations levelled at now deceased Fox News CEO Roger Ailes by a string of female employees.

But she insists its narrative goes far beyond the American TV network, opting instead for broader strokes to paint a vivid portrait of pre-Me Too society.

'The story it’s trying to tell is broader than Fox News,' she said. 'It’s much more about sexual harassment and the women.'

Tasteful: A sheer floral dress and jacket, both from Valentino Haute Couture, and Christian Louboutin pumps were worn by Nicole during the Elle shoot

Nicole spoke to ELLE while featuring in a glossy black and white cover shoot, in which she strikes a series of coquettish poses.

In the first the star exudes old school Hollywood glamour in a plunging top, underpinning and veil, all from Dior Haute Couture.

Posing for photographer Zoey Grossman, Nicole fully exposes her cleavage while leaning forward, her swept hair revealing a pair of stunning earrings from Dior Fine Jewelry.

Not yet: Nicole admits there might be a wait before she returns as Celeste Wright in a third series of Big Little Lies

New role: She will however be back in Bombshell, an account of the sexual harassment accusations levelled at now deceased Fox News CEO Roger Ailes by a string of female employees

Nicole also commands attention in an androgynous black three-piece suit featuring a tailcoat, cummerband and fitted trousers, all from Polo Ralph Lauren.

The accessories are no less lavish, with Nicole opting for a sparkling Cartier ring and Chanel loafers while sitting for Grossman.

Elsewhere a sheer floral dress and jacket, both from Valentino Haute Couture, and Christian Louboutin pumps, add a splash of vibrancy to an otherwise neutral set of colours.

Other women to feature on Elle's prestigious list include Dolly Parton, Zendaya, Jodie Turner-Smith, Natalie Portman, Mindy Kaling, Lena Waith and Melina Matsoukas.

The November edition of Elle is out now.
description: The Australian actress joins an array of empowered female high-achievers - among them Margot Robbie, Scarlett Johansson and Gwyneth Paltrow - following a productive year.
